newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Colombo stocks ease, volume up on foreign buyin.
newsitem.headline: Colombo stocks ease, volume up on foreign buyin.

text.p: Sri Lanka stocks closed lower on Wednesday, although turnover was up sharply on foreign buying of selected blue chips, brokers said.
The all share index closed 1.74 points lower at 592.66. John Keells Holdings fell four rupees to 190, Richard Pieris & Co 3.75 to 80.25.
Most price declines were on small quantities, and by retail investors looking for last-minute profits to celebrate the December festivities, brokers said.
"Retail investors are taking every last cent they can from the stock market to spend in the supermarket," said one broker.

Turnover, however, was a healthy 149.4 million rupees on 3.8 million shares due to foreign buying of National Development Bank and Asian Hotels, brokers said. Closing turnover on Tuesday was 9.8 million rupees.
"There are foreign investors picking up volumes of selected stocks, though local institutions are waiting to see where the index will bottom out," said Shakthi Ranatunga a broker at Lanka Securities.
Local buying of 668,100 Lanka Orix Leasing at 142.25 propped up turnover. A parcel of 600,000 Tea Services shares was held on overnight bid at 60 rupees. --Prithi kodagoda (941) 434319
